example.eg: She carried the heavy load up the hill.
example.egtrans: 她把很重的东西背到小山上。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 负载, 负荷, 负荷

example.eg: The truck driver picked up a load at the dock.
example.egtrans: 货车司机在码头装了一车货物。

example.eg: Have you ever seen a shooting star? I've seen loads.
example.egtrans: 你见过流星吗？我看过很多。

example.eg: I spent loads of money when I went shopping.
example.egtrans: 我去购物时花了许多钱。

example.eg: I miss you loads.
The men loaded the truck and then drove away.
example.egtrans: 工人们将货物装进卡车，开走了。

example.eg: They loaded the goods into the delivery truck.
example.egtrans: 他们把货物装载到货运卡车上。

example.eg: We loaded the wheelbarrow with bricks.
example.egtrans: 我们用砖头把手推车装满了。

example.eg: He emptied the washing machine, hung the clothes to dry and put in another load.
example.egtrans: 他清空了洗衣机，把洗好的衣物晾起来，然后又开始洗下一缸。

dsense.name: load, -load
dsense.guideword: often as suffix (measure: how many) (后缀)

example.eg: I estimate that there are 50 truck-loads of dirt here.
The pillars of the building support the load of the floors above.
He felt the load lifted off of him when he finished his last exam.
example.egtrans: 当完成最后一门考试时，他如释重负。

example.eg: I have a heavy load this semester.
The boy prepared the next load for the soldier.
example.egtrans: 男孩为士兵装入下一枚炮弹。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 装入枪（炮）的一次弹药的量

example.eg: Trucks must pull up to the dock to load.
example.egtrans: 卡车必须开往码头去装载货物。

example.eg: The ship is loading at the pier.
The soldier stopped firing so that he could load.
example.egtrans: 战士停止射击，以便能装弹药。

example.eg: In the old days, it often took a long time for a web page to load.
The managers loaded his employees with projects.
The spring rains loaded the trees with fruit.
I get an error message when I try to load the page.
The farmer loaded the donkey down.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使承担重负, 使负荷沉重

dsense.name: load [sb] down, load down [sb]
dsense.guideword: often passive (burden with problems, work, etc.)

example.eg: My boss is always loading me down and then blaming me for not finishing my projects on time.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 加以重负，加以重压, 使负担过重

example.eg: We loaded up the car and set off for the beach.
I have to help load up the luggage for our camping trip.
I'll cook up a load of chicken legs and we can take them on our picnic.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 许多, 大量, 一大堆

example.eg: Jess has taught me a load about computer coding.
The attorney's growing caseload made him consider hiring an assistant.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 最大容量, 最大载量, 最大负载

example.eg: These lorries can carry extremely heavy loads.
Bringing up three children on her own was a heavy load for Helen.
The engineer is calculating the load-bearing capacity of the steel girder.
The builders knocked down the load-bearing wall between the kitchen and the dining room.

dsense.name: load [sb/sth] down with [sth], load down [sb/sth] with [sth]
dsense.guideword: often passive (make carry [sth] heavy) (通常指重物)

example.eg: Lucy loaded her husband down with suitcases.

dsense.name: load [sb] down with [sth]
dsense.guideword: figurative, often passive (burden with problems, work, etc.)

example.eg: The manager loaded the staff down with work.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 加以...的重负，加以...的重压, 使...的负担过重

dsense.name: a load of money, loads of money

example.eg: He won a load of money playing cards.
I loaded up the shopping cart with groceries.
The sailors offloaded the cargo.
The workers were offloading the cargo onto the waiting trucks.

dsense.name: offload [sth] onto [sb], off-load [sth] onto [sb], offload [sth] on [sb], off-load [sth] on [sb]
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (pass something unwanted on to)

example.eg: I managed to offload that awful project onto Audrey.
Carol felt a great sense of relief once she had offloaded her secret.
Angie offloaded her concerns onto her best friend.
When I have nobody to talk to, I offload in internet forums.

dsense.name: viral load
dsense.guideword: (amount of a virus in body fluid)

example.eg: My workload is particularly heavy this week.
